result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin P. Johnston

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
NO POSSESSION OF FIREARMS
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NOT TO OPERATE A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT A VALID LICENSE 
Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center for fingerprints and photograph.

9:33 AM Defendant Kevin P. Johnston in Court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in Court for Kevin P. Johnston.  Assistant District Attorney Kaley Walker in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  State request $10,000 signature bond w/conditions of not to possess dangerous weapons, including knives.  Absolute sobriety.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  Atty. Nelson objects to knives.  Court orders bond w/amended condition.  Advises of additional condition re: prints/photos.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy Preliminary Hearing, Defendant waives.  Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.  Defendant qualifies for PD.  Adjourned at 9:40 AM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
